examples.full_description: Author can be created with valid data

examples.description: is expected to validate that :name cannot be empty/falsy
examples.full_description: Author Basic validations is expected to validate that :name cannot be empty/falsy

examples.description: is expected to validate that :name is case-sensitively unique
examples.full_description: Author Basic validations is expected to validate that :name is case-sensitively unique

examples.description: is expected to validate that the length of :phone_number is 10
examples.full_description: Author Basic validations is expected to validate that the length of :phone_number is 10

exception.message:
Expected Author to validate that the length of :phone_number is 10, but
this could not be proved.
  After setting :phone_number to ‹"xxxxxxxxx"›, the matcher expected the
  Author to be invalid and to produce the validation error "is the wrong
  length (should be 10 characters)" on :phone_number. The record was
  indeed invalid, but it produced these validation errors instead:

  * name: ["can't be blank"]
  * phone_number: ["xxxxxxxxx Should be 10 digits, everyone knows you
    big dummy!"]

examples.full_description: Post Basic validations is expected to validate that :title cannot be empty/falsy

examples.description: is expected to validate that the length of :content is at least 250
examples.full_description: Post Basic validations is expected to validate that the length of :content is at least 250

examples.description: is expected to validate that the length of :summary is at most 250
examples.full_description: Post Basic validations is expected to validate that the length of :summary is at most 250

examples.description: is expected to validate that :category is either ‹"Fiction"› or ‹"Non-Fiction"›
examples.full_description: Post Basic validations is expected to validate that :category is either ‹"Fiction"› or ‹"Non-Fiction"›

exception.message:
Expected Post to validate that :category is either ‹"Fiction"› or
‹"Non-Fiction"›, but this could not be proved.
  After setting :category to ‹"Non-Fiction"›, the matcher expected the
  Post to be valid, but it was invalid instead, producing these
  validation errors:

  * title: ["can't be blank", "is invalid"]
  * content: ["is too short (minimum is 250 characters)"]
  * category: ["is not included in the list"]

examples.description: is expected to allow :title to be ‹"You Won't Believe These True Facts"›

examples.description: is expected not to allow :title to be ‹"True Facts"›
examples.full_description: Post Custom validations: title is clickbait is expected not to allow :title to be ‹"True Facts"›
